de.systemagmbh.tools.util
Class CSysProgArgParser

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.util.CSysProgArgParser
public final class CSysProgArgParser
extends Object

class CSysProgArgParser. Parses the program arguments and holds them in memory. By default the keys are not case sensitive. Usage: 

 
	void main(String[] args)
	{
		CSysProgArgParser pap=new CSysProgArgParser(args);

		String default="d:\\temp";
		String fileName=pap.get("f", default);

		if(!pap.check("h"))
			System.out.println("no help available");

		String state={ "ON", "AN" }
		if(!pap.check("s", state))
			System.out.println("state off");
	}

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $, $JustDate: 30.08.00 $
Author:
RH, Udo Friedrich, Christian Wohanka

put

public void put(String key,

check

public boolean check(String key,
                     String compareVal)
Check the existence of the given key and compares the value to a given one. The value compare process is NOT case sensitive.

Parameters:
key - possible key (with or without the leading SIG_CHAR).
compareVal - value that will be used to compare the stored value to.
Returns:
true if the key is found and compareVal matches the stored value, false otherwise or if compareVal refers to 'null'.

check

public boolean check(String key,
                     String compareVal,
                     boolean caseSensitive)
Check the existence of the given key and compare the stored value to a given one.

Parameters:
key - possible key (with or without the leading SIG_CHAR).
compareVal - value the stored value should be compared to.
caseSensitive - decides whether the compare process should be case sensitive or not
Returns:
true if the key is found and compareVal matches the stored value, false otherwise or if compareVal refers to 'null'.

check

public boolean check(String key,
                     String[] compareVals)
Check the existence of the given key and compares the stored values to an array of given ones. The value compare process is NOT case sensitive.

Parameters:
key - possible key (with or without the leading SIG_CHAR).
compareVals - array of values which will be used to compare with the stored value to.
Returns:
true if the key is found and at least one of the compareVals matches the stored value, false otherwise or if compareVals refers to 'null'.

check

Parameters:
key - possible key (with or without the leading SIG_CHAR).
compareVals - array of values which will be used to compare with the stored value to.
caseSensitive - decides whether the compare process should be case sensitive or not
Returns:
true if the key is found and at least one of the compareVals matches the stored value, false otherwise or if compareVals refers to 'null'.
